FuncDef:
The mpls te resv-style command specifies a reservation style.
The undo mpls te resv-style command restores the default reservation style.
By default, the reservation style is shared explicit (SE).
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To specify a resource reservation style for MPLS TE tunnels, run the mpls te resv-style command.
The SE style allows CR-LSPs in a tunnel to share the same bandwidth. The SE style must be set if a CR-LSP is re-established using the make-before-break (MBB) mechanism.
